contentrichtext.text: The '''Forest River''' is an {{convert|81.0|mi|km|adj=mid|-long}}<ref name=NHD>U.S. Geological Survey. National Hydrography Dataset high-resolution flowline data. [http://viewer.nationalmap.gov/viewer/ The National Map], accessed June 8, 2011</ref> tributary of the [[Red River of the North]] in eastern [[North Dakota]] in the [[United States]]. It rises in [[Walsh County, North Dakota|Walsh County]] and flows southeast and east, past the towns of [[Fordville, North Dakota|Fordville]] and [[Minto, North Dakota|Minto]], and forms a confluence with the Red approximately {{convert|40|mi}} north of [[Grand Forks, North Dakota|Grand Forks]]. ==See also== *[[List of North Dakota rivers]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *{{GNIS|1029003|Forest River}} *[http://viewer.nationalmap.gov/viewer/?p=default&b=base1&q=48.3580397%20-97.1459042&l=13 Forest River on the USGS National Map] *{{cite web |url =http://cfpub.epa.gov/surf/huc.cfm?huc_code=09020308 |title =Forest Watershed |publisher =U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) |accessdate =2012-09-20}} {{coord|48|21|28|N|97|08|45|W|format=dms|display=title|type:river_region:US-ND_source:GNIS}} [[Category:Rivers of North Dakota]] {{NorthDakota-geo-stub}}
